block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
FILM

Chappaqua ''Menus in the Movies,'' film screenings followed by discussion and desserts: ''Animal House,'' directed by John Landis. Friday at 7 p.m. Free. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
Tarrytown ''Speedy,'' comedy directed by Donald Sosin. April 15 at noon. $6 and $9. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.
Valhalla ''3-Iron,'' directed by Kim Ki-duk; in Korean with English subtitles. Friday at 8 p.m. $8 and $9. Westchester Community College, Academic Arts Theater, 75 grasslands Road. (914) 606- 6262.
FOR CHILDREN

Bronx Family art project, with flower and leaf prints. April 21 and 22. Free with admission: $2 and $4. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.

Irvington ''Appalachian Fiddle Faddles,'' family folk tales, presented by M and M productions and YCP Theaterworks. April 21 at 2 p.m. Free. Irvington Public Library, 12 South Astor Street. (914) 591-7840.
Katonah ''Appalachian Fiddle Faddles,'' presented by M and M productions and YCP Theaterworks. Monday at 7 p.m. Free. Katonah Village Library, 26 Bedford Road. (914) 232-3508.
Nyack ''High School Musical,'' presented by the Helen Hayes Youth Theater. Through April 22. $15. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Suffern ''Mammoth Follies,'' an original dinosaur musical; presented by the Hudson Vagabond Puppets. April 15 at 2:30 p.m. $10 and $12. Cultural Arts Theater, 145 College Road. (845) 732-8186.
White Plains Tom Chapin, singer-songwriter; family concert. April 22 at 1 and 4 p.m. $18 and $20. White Plains Performing Arts Center, 11 City Place. (914) 328-1600.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.

Yonkers ''Mother Goose Time,'' nursery rhymes, stories songs and finger plays. Ages 2 to 4. Through May 17. Free; registration required. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Dobbs Ferry ''Annual A Cappella Extravaganza,'' a cappella groups from various schools. April 15 at 2 p.m. $5 and $10. The Masters School, 49 Clinton Avenue. (914) 332-5953.
Katonah ''Ringing in the Spring,'' performance by the Katonah Celebration Ringers hand bell group. April 15 at 2 p.m. $12. John Jay Homestead Historic Site, Route 22. (914) 232-5651.
Middletown The Kennedys, folk duet. April 15 at 3 p.m. $22 and $25. Morrison Mansion, Orange County Community College. (845) 343-3049.
New Rochelle Tribute to Cole Porter by Catherine Dupuis, jazz singer, and Russ Kassoff, pianist, and his trio. Tuesday at noon. $10. Joyce Auditorium, Iona College. (914) 637-7796.
Nyack ''Songwriters by the River in the Riverspace Cafe,'' with Joe D'Urso and Andy Krikun, singer-songwriters. Friday at 8 p.m. $10. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Ossining Dikki Du and the Zydeco Krew. April 15, 5 to 9:30 p.m. $18. Zydeco Hall, 7 Old Albany Post Road. (914) 528-7612.
Peekskill The Rippingtons, jazz. Friday at 8 p.m. $30 to $35. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333 .

Purchase Westchester Philharmonic, classical and jazz music by Mozart, Ellington and others. April 21 and April 22. $22 to $67; reservations required. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 682-3707, Extension 10.
Purchase Purchase Dance Corps; tribute to Merce Cunningham and Bill T. Jones. Friday through April 29. $13.50 and $20. PepsiCo Theater at Purchase College, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6166.
Rye Pacifica String Quartet, performing works by Mendelssohn, Janacek and Smetana. April 15 at 8 p.m. $35. Congregation Emanu-El, 2125 Westchester Avenue East. (914) 967-4382.

Tarrytown Citizen Cope, musician, producer and bandleader. Friday at 8 p.m. Sold out. ''A Night of Golden Oldies,'' with The Duprees, The Devotions and others. April 21 at 7 p.m. $35.50 and $40.50. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.
OUTDOORS

Cuddebackville Maple syrup pancake breakfast and spring festival, with boat rides and a flea market. April 22, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. $2.75 and $5. Neversink Valley Area Museum, 26 Hoag Road. (845) 754-8870.

Scarsdale ''Earth Day Celebration,'' with refreshments, demonstrations and games. April 22, 1 to 3:30 p.m. Free; registration required. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Greenburgh Nature Center, 99 Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
SPOKEN WORD

Tarrytown Andrew Burnstein, author of ''The Original Knickerbocker,'' lecture and reading. April 15 at 1:30 p.m. Free. Washington Irving's Sunnyside, 89 West Sunnyside Lane, off Route 9. (914) 631-8200.
THEATER

ANNANDALE-ON-HUDSON ''Jane Eyre,'' drama adapted from Charlotte Bronte's novel by Polly Teale, presented by The Acting Company. Wednesday at 7 p.m. $15 and $30. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts, Bard College, (845) 758-7900.
Croton Falls ''Crimes of the Heart,'' comedy by Beth Henley. Through May 6. $25 to $29. Schoolhouse Theater, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.
Dobbs Ferry Shakespeare's ''King Lear,'' adapted and performed by the Red Monkey Theater Group. Through April 21. $12 and $18. Dobbs Ferry High School, 505 Broadway. (914) 693-1646.

Pleasantville Insights and Revelations Performance Series: ''The Disappearing World,'' drama by Kelly Stuart. April 21 at 8:30 p.m. $20. Richard G. Rosenthal Jewish Community Center, 600 Bear Ridge Road. (914) 764-4028.

White Plains ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' play about Emily Dickinson; presented by M and M productions. April 15 at 2:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Annandale-on-Hudson ''In Someone Else's Skin,'' ''Facts on the Ground'' and ''Stutter and Twitch,'' mixed-media group exhibitions. April 15 through 29. Reception: April 15, 1 to 4 p.m. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bard College, Center for Curatorial Studies. (845) 758-7598.

Armonk ''The Power of Color: The Power of the Brush,'' paintings by Joyce Wenglowski. Through April 15. Lecture by Gillian Greenhill Hannum, professor of art history at Manhattanville College: April 15 at 4 p.m.; $5, reservations required. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Beacon ''Bau 28: Mud/Bone Studio 889: Encounters with Pablo Neruda,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 6. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.

Beacon ''Models on Main Street,'' photography group show. Through June 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturdays, 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Muddy Cup Coffee House, 129 Main Street. (845) 440-8855.
Briarcliff Manor Watercolors by Edward Malsberg. Through May 12. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.
Bronx ''Sly,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 21. $5. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.
Bronx ''Sugar Buzz,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 15. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Lehman College Art Gallery, Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8731.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. Reception: April 15, 1 to 4:30 p.m. $2 to $4; members and under 6, free; free for everyone on Tuesdays; free for everyone Saturdays, 9 a.m. to noon. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.

Bronxville ''A Celebration of Childhood,'' watercolors by Miriam Schulman. Through April 29. Reception: April 29, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Tuesdays, to 9 p.m.; Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bronxville Public Library, 201 Pondfield Road. (914) 337-7680.

Croton Falls ''People Who Love People,'' group show. Through May 6. Reception: April 15, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Schoolhouse Gallery, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-3461.

Dobbs Ferry ''From Spain to Avalon,'' mixed media exhibition. Through May 22. Reception: Wednesday, 2 to 4 p.m. Hours: Sundays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. St. Cabrini Nursing Home, 115 Broadway. (914) 693-6800, Extension 522.

Katonah ''Young Artists 2007,'' exhibition by high school students. April 22 through May 6. Reception: April 21, 5 to 7 p.m. Admission: $5, $3 for seniors and students. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

Kingston ''The Door As Art Form'' and ''Portals,'' mixed-media group shows. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 1 to 6 p.m. Arts Society of Kingston Arts Center, 97 Broadway. (845) 338-0331.

New Paltz ''From Impressionist to Modernist: The Paintings of Woodstock Artist Charles Rosen.'' Through May 20. Free. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Samuel Dorsky Museum of Art, SUNY New Paltz. (845) 257-3844.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.

North Salem ''Brush with Nature,'' group exhibition featuring traditional and modern brush painting techniques. Through June 5. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.

Peekskill ''First Look II,'' mixed media exhibition by art students. Through Sept. 30. $5, adults; $1, children; members, free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; group tours available by appointment. Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art, 1701 Main Street. (914) 788-7166.

Pelham ''Lovely Dark and Deep: Women Artists Retake the Fairy Tale,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 28. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525.

Port Chester ''East West Fusion,'' recent works by five member artists, with ''Joys of Raku,'' group show. Through April 28. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Clay Art Center, 40 Beech Street. (914) 937-2047.
Purchase ''On The Cusp,'' an instillation by Laurel Garcia Colvin. Through May 12. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Brownson Gallery, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5331.

Purchase MFA Thesis Exhibition Series: paintings by Andrew Hunt. Monday through Friday. Reception: Thursday, 5 to 7 p.m. Durst Family Humanities Building, Purchase College, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.

Purchase ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. ''Lesley Dill: Tremendous World,'' installations. Through June 3. ''New Media: When,'' group show. Through May 20. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Rye ''Spotlight on Historical Costumes,'' a collection of seasonal costumes. Through June 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.
Tivoli ''The Body Eclectic,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 29. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Tivoli Artists Co-op, 60 Broadway. (845) 757-2667.
Valhalla ''Recurrents,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 21. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Thursdays, 6 to 8 p.m. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.

West Nyack '' A Sequence of Steps,'' photographs by Elizabeth Knowles. ''Jiffy Pop,'' mixed-media group show. Both through April 29. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockland Center for the Arts, 27 South Greenbush Road. (845) 358-0877.
